intro: Sicyos angulatus, commonly known as the angular sicyos, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cucurbitaceae. It is a climbing vine characterized by its angular, ridged stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are followed by orange or red, fleshy fruits. Native to Central and South America, it thrives in warm, humid climates. Sicyos angulatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
